result.execSummary:
The defendant Mallory Ann Merritt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Intend GreatBod. Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(5).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 11/06/2015 @ 1:30pm

Probation may be served in Atlanta, Georgia

miscConds.notes: Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis. Pay all costs, fees, assessment and surcharges including DNA surcharge. Any remaining to be paid during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% prison funds (if she serves initial confinement). Cash bail applied.
- No Contact with firearms. Court advises defendant she cannot possess firearms, she must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until her civil rights are restored.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Attend and successfully complete an Anger Management program.
- Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Take all prescribed medication.
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation.
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety (except for prescribed medication).
- Random screens.
- No drugs without a valid prescription.
- No Contact with the victim that rises to the level of probable cause for arrest for domestic abuse or harrassment.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- Obtain/maintain employment as able.
- Attend the probation review hearing on 11-06-15.

timeConds.notes: STAYED for the use at the discretion of the probation department

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing AUGUST 5, 2015 received and filed. (29 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to THE INSTITUTION.

Defendant Mallory Ann Merritt in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Bail Refund Packets
8/14/15 Bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 11-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mallory Ann Merritt in court with Attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Audra E., defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  COURT ADVISES the defendant she cannot possess firearms, she must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until her civil rights are restored. 

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  4 years with  4 days credit, consecutive to any other sentence -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  2 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  2 years

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
- Court finds that the probation may be served in Atlanta, Georgia
- Court ordered 60 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.
- Attend and successfully complete an Anger Mgmnt program
- Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment
- Take all prescribed medication
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety (except for prescribed medication)
- Random Screens
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- No contact with the victim that rises to the level of probable cause for arrest for 'domestic abuse or harrassment'
- Obtain GED/HSD
- Obtain/Maintain employment - as able
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge).  Cash bail posted on this case to be applied to monies owed.  Any remaining to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Any remaining balance to be returned to the remittur.
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on 11-06-2015

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Attend and successfully complete an Anger Mgmnt program
- Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment
- Take all prescribed medication
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety (except for prescribed medication)
- Random Screens
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- No contact with the victim that rises to the level of probable cause for arrest for 'domestic abuse or harrassment'
- Obtain GED/HSD
- Obtain/Maintain employment - as able
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge).  Cash bail posted on this case to be applied to monies owed.  Any remaining to be paid during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Any remaining balance to be returned to the remittur.
- No contact with firearms

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds (if she serves initial confinement)

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
from Attorney Susan Roth transmitting a medical report received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm
Statements made by Azeez H.  Court modified the no contact order to a NO VIOLENT CONTACT ORDER.  Parties MAY NOT live together.

Defendant Mallory Ann Merritt in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for sentencing.  Court is in trial and cannot hear the matter.  Court ordered hearing adjourned.  Statements made by Azeez H. as to sentencing.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Mallory Ann Merritt
Current: 9007 West Beloit Road, Apt.  325, Milwaukee, WI 53227   (Effective: 03-11-2015)
Prior: 9007 West Beloit Road,#325, Milwaukee, WI 53227

Defendant Mallory Ann Merritt in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  The 6/15/15 jury trial is vacated.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mallory Ann Merritt in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail refund check packet.
Statements made by Azeez H.  Court denied the request to modify the no contact order.

Defendant Mallory Ann Merritt in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety.

$2500.00 bail to be returned. Oral No Weapons Order  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-23-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Azeez H. or the residence or place of employment

Defendant Mallory Ann Merritt in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Anthony E. White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.

Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.vb
